data.headline: US stocks edged higher with the Dow approaching record highs amid renewed rate-cut expectations
bullets: Flat December retail and core sales, along with softer employment costs, sharpened focus on potential Fed easing
Treasury yields slipped, supporting equities and prompting Q4 GDP downgrades
Nasdaq outperformed, led by gains in Spotify and Datadog
Recent AI-chip rebound paused as TSMC-driven volatility weighed on the sector
Earnings reactions were mixed across names including Credo, S&P Global, Coca-Cola, ON Semiconductor, Incyte, CVS, and BP
